newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX crude hovers about unchanged late session.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX crude hovers about unchanged late session.

text.p: NYMEX crude recovered from session lows by Thursday afternoon to hover about unchanged amid building bullish sentiment following Wednesday's rebound from sharply lower levels.

"By and large the psychology of the market has changed after we were able to discount the bearish build in gasoline stocks. We had what is called an API reversal," said Nauman Barakat, trader with Prudential Securities in New York.
At 1448 EDT, June crude was up one cent at $21.40 a barrel after falling to a session low of $21.18 early afternoon.
Spot crude retraced around a 50 cent loss Wednesday, falling initially on large builds in crude and gasoline stocks reported by the American Petroleum Institute (API) Tuesday evening.
But, June crude was under some pressure on Thursday amid selling in the June/July crude spread by a commercial player, dealers said.
The June/July spread was flat versus a 10 cent backwardation on Wednesday. Backwardation means the contract nearer in time is more expensive than the later one.

June heating oil was up 0.18 cent at 56.60 cents a gallon. June gasoline was under pressure, off 0.28 cent at 64.10 cents a gallon after Tosco Corp announced the restart of its Trainer, Pennsylvania refinery.

The Trainer refinery will add about 100,000 barrels per day of gasoline supply. It had been shut since early 1996 for a $50 million modernization after Tosco acquired the plant from British Petroleum.
Tosco had said the official restart would be mid-May and dealers had known the refinery, which has total capacity of 150,000 barrels per day, was being tested by Tosco this week.
-- Harry Milling, New York Energy Desk, 212-859-1761
